WHAT IS ASTRONOMY?
Astronomy is the study of the universe and everything in it. This includes stars, planets, galaxies, and other objects that are far away from us. Astronomers use special tools like telescopes and computers to learn about the universe and figure out how it works. They want to know how the universe started, how it has changed over time, and what it will be like in the future. By studying the universe, astronomers can make new discoveries and learn more about the world around us.
